item.title: Legacy Code Rocks: From Monolith to Understanding with Nelida Velazquez
item.description: Going from monolith to microservices is one of the most popular topics in software engineering. But jumping the boat without understanding why can be a dangerous (and expensive) adventure.&nbsp; Today we talk with . Nelida is a senior software engineer at , a cyber security company that offers pentest as a service. As a backend developer, she had numerous opportunities to witness ill-informed migrations from monolith to microservices, and she is sharing her experience with us.&nbsp; When you finish listening to this episode, connect with Nelida on X and visit her blog at .&nbsp; Mentioned in this episode: Nelida on X at: Nelida’s blog at &nbsp; &nbsp;

item.title: Functional Error Handling in .NET With the Result Pattern
item.description: How should you handle errors in your code? This has been a topic of many discussions, and I want to share my opinion. One school of thought suggests using exceptions for flow control. This is not a good approach because it makes the code harder to reason about. The caller must know the implementation details and which exceptions to handle. Exceptions are for exceptional situations. Today, I want to show you how to implement error handling using the Result pattern. It's a functional approach to error handling, making your code more expressive.
item.author: (Milan Jovanović)
